text:
Hey all! If anyone or their clients currently use the collected forms tool, we've just released a beta where collected forms will now map to existing HubSpot properties instead of creating new properties: <https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/getting-started-with-the-HubSpot-crm-free/how-to-use-the-collected-forms-tool>

This is automatically un-gated to all new portals going forward, but if anyone has any existing customers who already use collected forms in their portal and would like this functionality please feel free to fill out this form and I can un-gate them for this feature: <https://share.hsforms.com/115ljizaGS5q4tsFPc5Fx8g1btlk>
Just to clarify - collected forms- are the non-HS forms that your script is able to catch the submission and log the info into HS while allowing the form to submit normally too.?
<@U7SL518D6> Yes sir that is basically what it does. It also creates new contact properties if it cant match them up.
Super cool

The contact properties go into their own section under the standard contact area. Beware of using this with .net applications… a page that is wrapped in a form will create a crap ton of contact properties out of every conceivable thing.
<@U7SL518D6> question.. the sandbox should be able to use the dynamic pages right? to texst them?

I believe so but I haven’t gotten as much out of dynamic pages as I should. Often when I have a task that makes sense to use a dynamic page the blog still solves the problem better(marketers like that editing interface better than big database tables.)

You should just need to add the path to the dynamic page and it should work. Page will likely have to be published to staging. From what I gather Staged pages are actually normal pages, just separated out kinda like the website pages and landing pages are, they use the staging domain however. and when a page goes from staging to live, the page it’s replacing becomes archived and the staged page takes it’s URL. That’s basically it
<@U38EZFVFE> Sandbox does work for dynamic pages
why isnt mine then.
herm
My sand box forwards to the default HubSpot domain when i try to view a dynamic page
maybe there’s a redirect under url mappings on accident
is it just me or did the <https://spin.d.pr/ocOaNb+> design preview button stop allowing you to view your module not in the preview window….
I wasnt selecting the table for dynamic pages on the page level. My bad.

Hey <@U38EZFVFE> In the past collected forms never mapped to existing contact properties and always created new ones. The new release won’t create any new contact properties and will map to existing properties.
Yep :thumbsup_all:
i know I can just make it a link and be done, but I want to track conversions and a/b split test

Just a hunch as to why it’s not working Parag the CTA is rendered via JS, and I think they don’t execute the hubl in the fields for it. Your use-case is interesting and I can see that being pretty useful, hope someone can answer for ya. my only solution would be to find a way to pass that information another way. I’m not sure how exactly though.

maybe could hide the email field and make it a form, but that seems hacky to me.
going to stick to just making it a link

Hi folks! As some of you already know, HubSpot Academy is sunsetting the current Design Certification. I've been hard at work on a CMS for Developers Certification and the first two lessons should be going live 8/30. Here's a link to a blog post with some more details and an FAQ. Please also feel free to DM me with questions. <https://designers.HubSpot.com/blog/were-sunsetting-the-HubSpot-design-certification-heres-why>
How can I make an email template an "opt in" email vs copying the opt in template and updating it?
I think that’s a good move, it really was broad and some of our marketers were horribly lost. It would be nice to have the new cert dig into HUBL.
:+1: Oh it will...
That sounds menacing!
Bring on the :male_mage::mage:
When a person submits a blog subscribe form (the ones generated when you create a blog) does it automatically add that person to that blogs subscription type?

Overall, i am trying to figure out when someone submits to those generated forms for "subscribing to a blog", then marketing sends email to those based on a list created from that blog form, how can someone then opt out of just that blog without having to go to preference page or using the unsubscribe from all link. Is there anyway to have a link for just unsubscribing from a particular blog (like a one click unsubscribe)?
We had a user submit to the blog form, but nothing is showing under "Communications Subscriptions" on their contact record

Update on above, because the GDPR tools are active, I _think_ thats the reason nothing is being assigned off the bat to the communications subscriptions because _technically_ they filled in the form but didnt agree to communications.
